meanings.definition: To cripple or disable by cutting the hamstring or tendons at the back of the knee.
meanings.sent1: The villain was caught hamstringing the hero, leaving him unable to walk.
meanings.sent2: The injury was so severe that it resulted in hamstringing the athlete for the entire season.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy thought it was funny to pretend he was hamstringing the toy rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected betrayal felt like someone was hamstringing my trust in others.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sharp blade hamstringing the rope was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: To hinder or impede the progress or development of something.
meanings.sent1: The heavy traffic was hamstringing our journey to the beach.
meanings.sent2: Lack of funding was hamstringing the research project, causing delays.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn knot in the rope seemed to be hamstringing our efforts to untangle it.
meanings.sent4: The constant rain was like a dark cloud hamstringing our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules were hamstringing our creativity, making it hard to innovate.
